text: Psalm 148
Let All Creation Praise Yahweh
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 148:1 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
Praise Yahweh from the heavens;
praise him in the heights.
Praise him, all his angels;
praise him, all his hosts.\f + \fr 148:2 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f*
Praise him, sun and moon;
praise him, all stars of light.
Praise him, ⸤highest heavens⸥,\f + \fr 148:4 \ft Literally “heaven\fq s \ft of the heavens” \f*
and waters above the heavens.
Let them praise the name of Yahweh,
because he commanded and they were created.
And he put them in place forever and ever,
\add by\add* a decree he gave that will not pass away.
Praise Yahweh from the earth—
great sea creatures and all deeps,
fire and hail, snow and cloud,\f + \fr 148:8 \ft The meaning of “cloud” is uncertain \f*
stormy wind doing his bidding,\f + \fr 148:8 \ft Hebrew “his word” \f*
the mountains and all hills,
fruit trees and all cedars,
beasts and all cattle,\f + \fr 148:10 \ft That is, wild and domesticated \f*
creeping things and ⸤flying birds⸥,\f + \fr 148:10 \ft Literally “bird of wing” \f*
kings of \add the\add* earth and all peoples,
princes and all judges of \add the\add* earth,
young men and young women as well,
\add the\add* old \add together\add* with \add the\add* young—
let them praise the name of Yahweh,
because his name alone \add is\add* is exalted.
His splendor \add is\add* above earth and heavens.
And he has raised high a horn for his people,
praise for all his faithful—
for the children of Israel,
a people close to him.
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 148:14 \ft Hebew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
